entries.content: When asked about sector experience, clarify the prospect's need: 'Is that because you're looking for someone that knows everything... or someone that can offer a fresh perspective?'
entries.notes: Used to clarify the underlying reason for the question and position value beyond just direct experience. Aligns with Clarify step.

entries.content: When asked about sector experience, clarify the consequence: 'If I told you I haven't, are you going to say this isn't going to work?'
entries.notes: Forces the prospect to reveal if experience is a vital requirement or a soft preference. Aligns with Clarify and Isolate steps (Clarify-Isolate-Overcome) and AAA (Acknowledge, Ask).

entries.content: Prospects may ask questions to trap you or uncover specific needs; don't assume the obvious answer is what they want.
entries.notes: Justification for using clarifying questions rather than simply stating experience.

entries.content: 'I get the feeling that if I tell you I haven't you're going to say this isn't going to work.'
entries.notes: Specific phrasing for the clarifying question technique, forcing the prospect to reveal the importance of experience.
